content.description:
Jupiter Sends a Divine Messenger

Age, nate, voca ventos et labere pennispenna, -ae, f.: wing
Troianorumque ducem, TyriaTyrius, -a, -um, adj.: Tyrian (related to the city of Tyre) KarthagineKarthago, -inis, f.: Carthage qui nunc 
exspectat fatisque datas non respicit urbes, 
adloquereadloquor, -i = loquor, -i et celeres deferdefero, deferre = ferro, ferre mea dicta per auras.
content.question: In lines 2-3, Tyria Karthagine qui nunc exspectat is translated

choices.label: who now waits in Tyrian Carthage
the Tyrian who now will wait for Carthage
who will now wait for the Tyrians in Carthage

content.answer: who now waits in Tyrian Carthage

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
